items.title: John Robertson was a ‚Äòscruffy, unfit‚Äô genius who did not get the kudos he deserved | Ewan Murray
items.summary: Forest great was loved in Nottingham but under-appreciated in Scotland before going on to thrive as a coach On the eve of a Celtic European tie 25 years ago, Stiliyan Petrov cut an increasingly agitated figure. The young Bulgarian, soon to shoot to prominence under Martin O‚ÄôNeill, was finding it impossible to snatch the ball from a rotund, wizened coach during a possession drill. Petrov‚Äôs teammates were cackling with laughter. John Robertson‚Äôs brilliance was understated enough in Scotland. Word of his talent in the game was never likely to reach Petrov as he grew up in deepest Bulgaria. Petrov is part of a recent generation who owe a debt of gratitude to Robertson the coach. More of them later. When news of Robertson‚Äôs death filtered through on Christmas Day, the prevailing sense was that his country had lost one of a kind. He was also an individual who, for reasons associated with his own modesty, really never received the kudos he deserved in the land of his birth. Continue reading...

items.title: Higuita doet 'Scorpion Kick' dertig jaar na dato nog eens over
items.summary: Ren√© Higuita gaat dertig jaar na zijn beroemde Scorpion Kick op Wembley wederom de wereld over. In een afscheidswedstrijd voor Mario Yepes deed de excentrieke doelman het nog eens dunnetjes over.

items.title: From 'mothballed' to MCG cauldron ‚Äì Bethell handed tough Ashes task
items.summary: No 3 has been a problem position for England in The Ashes with Ollie Pope struggling for form and his replacement Jacob Bethell was dismissed for just one on a 20-wicket opening day of the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.

items.title: Opnieuw arrestaties verricht in kader van Turks gokschandaal
items.summary: Het Turkse gokschandaal blijft om zich heengrijpen. Volgens verschillende Turkse media zijn er opnieuw 29 arrestatiebevelen uitgegaan. Veertien van die personen zijn voetballers. Ook voormalig Galatasaray-directeur Erden Timur is vrijdag opgepakt.

items.title: Emotional Kelce ponders retirement after Chiefs' home finale
items.summary: Travis Kelce has confirmed he is still pondering retirement from NFL after potentially playing his last home game for Kansas City Chiefs.

items.title: Howe wil duidelijkheid over stadionplannen Newcastle United
items.summary: Als Newcastle United structureel wil wedijveren met de top van de Premier League en die van Europa, moet er volgens manager Eddie Howe snel duidelijkheid komen over de stadionplannen. De opwaardering van de faciliteiten is in zijn ogen een cruciale factor.

items.title: Jokic makes NBA history with 56-point triple-double
items.summary: Nikola Jokic recorded a 56-point triple-double and set an NBA record with 18 points in overtime, leading the Denver Nuggets to a 142-138 win over the Minnesota Timberwolves on Christmas Day.

items.title: Wissa: There's more to come from me, Newcastle is my destiny
items.summary: Newcastle striker Yoane Wissa has promised there is more to come from him after an injury ravaged start to life on Tyneside.

items.title: Nix's late TD pass clinches win for Broncos over Chiefs
items.summary: Bo Nix found RJ Harvey in the end zone on a late go-ahead touchdown pass to propel the Denver Broncos past the Kansas City Chiefs 20-13 in the final game of the NFL's Christmas schedule.

items.title: Amorim stelt duidelijke voorwaarde aan vertrek Mainoo of Zirkzee
items.summary: Joshua Zirkzee lijkt deze winter alleen bij Manchester United te mogen vertrekken, als er een vervanger komt voor de Nederlandse spits. Voor Kobbie Mainoo geldt hetzelfde, liet manager R√∫ben Amorim weten in aanloop naar het Premier League-duel van vrijdagavond met Newcastle United.

items.title: This will be the Premier League's quietest Boxing Day ever: Where did all the games go?
items.summary: The day after Christmas is usually jam-packed with great Premier League matchups, but not this year. What gives?

items.title: Richards on U.S., Palace return: 'Won't be long'
items.summary: United States defender Chris Richards said it "won't be long" until he's back for Crystal Palace.

items.title: Amorim: Mainoo is the 'future of Manchester United'

items.title: Saliba: Arsenal targeting quadruple for this season
items.summary: Arsenal defender William Saliba has boldly predicted that the Gunners are capable of clinching an unprecedented quadruple this season to end their long-standing trophy drought.

items.title: 'We've got a little fat guy who will turn him inside out' - the genius of Robertson
items.summary: John Robertson, who has died aged 72, was dubbed "the Picasso of football" and made Brian Clough's great Nottingham Forest side tick, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.
